vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
necesitamos: need, we need (Necesitar, present, 1st person plural)

englishTranslation: Look! I need your help now!
vocabIncluded: necesito: need, I need (Necesitar, present, 1st person)
mírame: look at me (Mirar, imperative contraction)

englishTranslation: Don’t look at them as goods!
Do you think this weapon is the same?
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
crees: believe, you believe (Creer, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Cree que el tiempo no va a ser bueno, porque está mirando afuera.
englishTranslation: He believes the weather is not going to be good, because he is looking outside.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
cree: believes, he/she/it believes (Creer, present, 3rd person)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: De todas formas, necesitaba ser justo.
englishTranslation: In any case, he needed to be fair.
vocabIncluded: necesitaba: needed, he/she/it needed (Necesitar, imperfect, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Espero que no mire bajo la cama.
englishTranslation: I hope he doesn’t look under the bed.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
espero:  hope/wait/expect, I  hope/wait/expect  (Esperar, present, 1st person)
mire: look, he/she/it look (Mirar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

englishTranslation: I believe it if I look at it.
vocabIncluded: creo: believe, I believe (Creer, present, 1st person)
miro: look, I look (Mirar, present, 1st person)
mira: looks, he/she/it looks (Mirar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Miran la cosa que está alta.
englishTranslation: They look at the thing that is high.
vocabIncluded: miran: look, they look (Mirar, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Miras el fuego, pero no necesitas mirarlo.
englishTranslation: You look at the fire, but you don’t need to look at it.
vocabIncluded: miras: look, you look (Mirar, present, 2nd person)
necesitas: need, you need (Necesitar, present, 2nd person)

englishTranslation: He needs them to look at him.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
miren: look, they look (Mirar, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: No lo necesitan igual que tú lo necesitabas.
englishTranslation: They don’t need it the same way that you needed it.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
igual: in the same way / equally (adverb)
necesitabas: needed, you needed (Necesitar, imperfect, 2nd person)
necesitan: need, he/she/it need (Necesitar, present, 3rd person)

englishTranslation: I thought about what I needed.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
necesitaba: needed, I needed (Necesitar, imperfect, 1st person)
pensé: thought, I thought (Pensar, preterite, 1st person)

englishTranslation: I might need you to look at me.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
mires: look, you look (Mirar, subjunctive, 2nd person)
